post.summary: Asks IAM whether a certain subject has access to a certain resource
Add a public/private key pair to a subject. The private key is returned on the response, but is not stored in IAM.
AddMultiUserRestriction adds the specific restriction to the specified users

Authenticate subject takes a context, email and password and validates the password is correct. No response
is returned but an OK status indicates a successful authentication, while an Unauthenticated response will
be returned on a missing subject/persona, the persona is locked, or the password is not correct.
post.description:
Multiple authentication attempts with the incorrect password will lock the persona for a short time period.
This is to prevent a brute-force attempt at authenticating a user.

post.summary: Will change the email of a given subject persona.
Create the external ID of a user for a given external id type

Create session subject takes in credentials for a subject, whether it be an email and password or Google id token.
A response with a session is returned if authentication is successful, while an Unauthenticated response will
be returned on a missing subject/persona, the persona is locked, or the password is not correct.
post.description:
Multiple authentication attempts with the incorrect password will lock the persona for a short time period.
This is to prevent a brute-force attempt at authenticating a user.

post.summary:
Create Custom Session will create a session that contains the attributes for a subject.
in most cases a standard IAM session should be used.
Will delete the persona from a given subject.
DeleteUser deletes a user
Get the external ID of a user for a given external id type
GetMultiUsers returns the users specified by either their user ID or their unique namespace/email
Get a one-time-use, time-sensitive JWT that allows a caller to reset a password

deprecated: Use GetSessionToken in UserIAM
Asks IAM to exchange the caller-provided token for a IAM session token.

Deprecated: Use UserIAM.GetImpersonationToken or allow the desired workflow without impersonation
Asks IAM for a short lived token for a specific user.
This is a temporary endpoint until we back VBC, Marketplace, and SSC sessions by IAM.

Given a subject ID, will return the context that is associated to this persona.
Specifically, this is useful for getting the partner id from a user ID, if the user is in a type/namespace
context.
Returns a list of subject personas by their subject IDs. The request is scoped to a specific context.
Returns a list of subject personas by their emails. The request is scoped to a specific context.
List Personas will return a paged set of results of all the available personas across all contexts for a specific user.

List Personas by email will return a paged set of results of all the available personas across all contexts for a specific email.
DEPRECATED: use ListPersonas
ListSecurityLogs returns a list of security logs for a user

ListUsers returns will return a paged set of results. There is an option to get all.
For example, listing the users with an email and/or in a namespace

Will update/set/delete a subject personas attributes by its subject ID. Will return a not found error if the
subject persona doesn't exist.
Registers a policy associated with a resource with IAM that is evaluated whenever a subject requests access to that type of resource.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: RegisterPolicyRequest registers a policy with a resource in IAM.

post.summary: Registers a specific resource with IAM. This allows IAM to ask the resource owner about its resources.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: RegisterResourceRequest is issued by a ResourceOwner to tell IAM that they would like to expose a resource that IAM will control access to.

post.summary: Registers a resource owner with IAM. This sets an application up for integration with IAM access control system.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: RegisterResourceOwnerRequest is issued by a prospective ResourceOwner to tell IAM they intend to expose resources that IAM will control access to.

post.summary: Registers a subject with IAM, if the supplied context is already used, an already exists error will be returned.
Remove a public key pair from a subject. Tokens signed by the corresponding private key will no longer be valid.
RemoveMultiUserRestriction removes the specific restriction from the specified users
Will search across a specified context. Cross context searching is not supported.
Send an email with a token on it to a user to verify their email
UpdateUser updates fields on the User
Verify a user's email address
GetImpersonationToken produces a new token from the direct caller token for the requested impersonation if allowed
Asks IAM to exchange the caller-provided token for a IAM session token.
Gets the subject from the given session
Returns a short lived token that can be used to issue requests to other vendasta APIs.
List Personas given a session id will return a paged set of results of all the available personas across all contexts for a specific Subject.
Reset a password using the one-time-use, time-sensitive JWT obtained via IAM.GetResetPasswordToken
Access RPCs
Restrict users
Use your current password to change your password
Create External ID Mappings for users
UserAuxiliaryFieldSchema service rpcs

Credential exchange RPCs
Exchanges a claim signed using a client private key for an IAM user token.
Get External ID mappings for users
User RPCs
ListUserAuxiliaryData auxiliary_data_object_id in the AuxiliaryDataObjectID refers to the user_id
Unrestrict users
One time password
Send an email verification Email to the user
Send an email for the given template and template data
Update or insert user's external identifier
UpsertUserAuxiliaryData auxiliary_data_object_id in the AuxiliaryDataObjectID refers to the user_id
Given a token, marks a user's email as verified.
Determines if a resource can be accessed & returns explanation in event of access being denied.
Add a user role with attributes, failing if the role already exists on the user.
Backend Session Creation
User Management
Delete resource and all the policies associated with the given app ID and resource ID
List all role types
Policy Admin
Resource Admin

Role Management
RegisterUserRoleMetadata creates a new role "type"
Remove a user role.
Update the attributes of an existing user role, failing if the role doesn't exist on the user.
Partner Limits
Get a token for the specified user.

userId.title: A user ID will identify a unique namespaced email and it's personas

session.title: A session token (aka an IAM token)

ownerId.title: owner_id is the app_id of the ResourceOwner that owns the resource_id

resourceId.title: resource_id is the resource type that the subject wants to access

resourceEntityIdentifier.title:
deprecated: Use resource_entity_identifiers
resource_entity_identifier contains the information necessary to identify a specific resource of the type specified by resource_id

accessScope.description:
access_scope represents the reasons that the user wants to access the resource.
DEPRECATED: use the 'actions' field instead.

READ -> "READ"
WRITE -> "WRITE"
DELETE -> "DELETE"
LIST -> "LIST"

actions.description: actions represents the action that the user wants to perform on the resource.

resourceEntityIdentifiers.title: resource_entity_identifiers contains the information necessary to identify a set of resources of the type specified by resource_id

resourceAttributes.description:
resource_attributes contains the resource attributes to use during policy evaluation.
Only works for registered resources without a resource_owner_service_url specified.

typedExternalIdentifier.description: The type and value of external ID to create.

Credentials contains a subject's credentials for getting a session or a Google id token.
IAM will use this data to create a new IAM session that will be returned in the response.

session.title: A session token (aka an IAM identity token)

userIdentifier.title: Identifier of the user to update

paths.description: The set of field mask paths.

cursor.title: Cursor to begin the list from

actionId.title: Filter the list by an actionID

hasMore.title: Whether or not there are more logs

Namespace of the users, if present, only scopes if present.
The value of "" means users that exist outside of a namespace.

email.title: Email of the users, if present, scopes the list

cursor.description: Cursor allows paging of results, the next_cursor returned by the last response is expected.

pageSize.description: The number of results to return. A page size of -1 returns all.

userFilter.title: Limit which users are included in the results

sortOptions.title: ListUserSortField, defaults to created ascending if no sort options provided

nextCursor.description:
A string indicating the starting position of the next set of results. The client should pass this in the
the next request.

hasMore.description: A bool indicating if there are more results to be paged through.

iamv1OAuthCredentials.title: Credentials to be passed for an OAuth workflow

appId.title: app_id is a unique identifier for the ResourceOwner. It must be unique across all IAM resource owners. (eg "VBC")

resourceId.description: The unique identifier for the resource this policy will be applied to.

policyId.description: The identifier for this policy. This need only be unique within the scope of the resource.

policyName.title: policy_name is the human readable name of the policy, often phrased as a question (eg: "Can user access account group?")

operations.description:
Operations that a user may take on a resource.
In particular, these will be the operations that this policy is associated with, so if this policy is associated
with "read", and a user attempts to "read" this resource type, this policy would be evaluated.

DEPRECATED: use 'actions' instead.

READ -> "READ"
WRITE -> "WRITE"
DELETE -> "DELETE"
LIST -> "LIST"

actions.description:
The actions for which the policy will be registered.
The policy will run when an access check is run for ANY of its registered actions.
This field is a replacement for the old "operations" field.
Common actions include "READ", "WRITE", "DELETE" and "LIST", but you may
use any action which makes sense for your resource, e.g. "PUBLISH", "REFRESH", etc.

These values should be UPPER_SNAKE_CASE.

policy.description: policy is the boolean expression tree of boolean operators and attribute-based clauses that expresses the method by which the policy is evaluated.

iamv1Policy.description: A policy is a binary boolean expression tree of attribute-based clauses that determines whether a subject is authorized to access a resource in a specific context.

id.description: Identifier for a public key. The `kid` claim in a JWT specifies this field, telling us which key to verify the JWT with.

algorithmType.title: The algorithm used for the key

iamv1PublicKey.description: PublicKey is a key capable of validating a JWT that has been signed with a private key by someone else.

iamv1RegisterPolicyRequest.description: RegisterPolicyRequest registers a policy with a resource in IAM.

owner.title: owner is the definition of a resource owner

iamv1RegisterResourceOwnerRequest.description: RegisterResourceOwnerRequest is issued by a prospective ResourceOwner to tell IAM they intend to expose resources that IAM will control access to.

appId.title: app_id is a unique identifier for the ResourceOwner. It must be unique across all IAM resource owners. (eg "VBC")

resourceId.description: resource_id is an identifier for the resource that is unique within the resource owner's set of resources.

resourceName.title: resource_name is the human readable name of the resource (eg "Account Group")

resourceOwnerServiceUrl.title: resource_owner_service_url is the base url where a ResourceOwner grpc service is being served. IAM will use this service to ask about specific resources

requiredResourceParams.description:
required_resource_params is the set of identifiers that must be provided to ask the resource provider about a resource from
IAM's point of view. These parameters will need to be supplied by any client asking about this resource.
eg: ["pid", "account_group_id"] means that each time IAM asks for one of these resources, it will require the client to specify
which "pid" and "account_group_id" they are asking about. IAM will proxy these parameters to the resource_owner_service_url.

resourceOwnerAudience.description: resource_owner_audience is a google id token audience. This is used by the resource owner to validate requests.

iamv1RegisterResourceRequest.description: RegisterResourceRequest is issued by a ResourceOwner to tell IAM that they would like to expose a resource that IAM will control access to.

userIdentifiers.title: The list of users to remove the restriction from

iamv1RestrictionType.description:
- RESTRICTION_TYPE_UNSET: Unset
 - RESTRICTION_TYPE_RESET_PASSWORD_BEFORE_LOGIN: This restriction prevents user from logging in. Automatically cleared on password reset.
 - RESTRICTION_TYPE_FROZEN: This restriction prevents user from logging in or passing any access checks.

updated.description: The time when the user was last updated.

firstName.title: The first name of the user

greetingName.title: The greeting name for the user

lastName.title: The last name of the user

languageCode.description:
End-User's locale, represented as a BCP47 [RFC5646] language tag. This is an ISO 639-1 Alpha-2 [ISO6391]
language code in lowercase and an ISO 3166-1 Alpha-2 [ISO31661] country code in uppercase, separated by a dash.
For example, en-US or fr-CA.

emailVerified.title: Whether or not a user has verified their email

roles.description:
A list of the roles (a.k.a. subject types, a.k.a. personas) which the user has.
Each role will be listed at most once.
E.g. For a user which has both a salesperson persona and partner persona, this field
will contain ['sales_person', 'partner']
Order is not guaranteed.
You can find the common role id's in the IAM sdk's `subject` package.

lastLogin.description: The time when the user was last authenticated.

publicKeys.description: Public keys that are able to validate tokens issued by the user.

iamv1User.title: A User is what uniquely occupies a namespace/email identity

subjectTypes.title: Filter Users by `has any of the following subject types`

searchTerms.title: Search terms filter (not scored), matches each search term if it exists within one of first name, last name, or email of the User

namespacedEmail.title: Deprecated: Prefer to use the `user_id` or `token` fields to avoid handling email, or for `user_id` being a more stable reference to a user who may have changed their email

namespacedSession.title:
Deprecated: Use the `token` field instead when the user is to be inferred from the token (ex. the session from `namespaced_session`, a session token, can be used in the `token` field)
Any namespace specified here is ignored because a token uniquely identifies a user

By default, the verification email will be sent with whitelabel branding inferred from the given UserIdentifier.
You can optionally set this field to a specific partner identifier to use a specific partner's whitelabel branding.

Set the value for the specified external id type
To set the value of multiple types add the operation multiple times

created.title: When the user was first created

updated.title: When the user was last updated

greetingName.description:
This is a special name used to greet individuals
which is used in certain languages.
It's unused in Western cultures.

languageCode.title: The preferred language of the user as a locale

lastLogin.description: The last time the user went through the "sign-in" flow.

emailVerified.title: Whether or not a user has verified their email

phoneNumbers.title: List of phone numbers associated to the user

timeZone.description: Time zone database representing the End-User's time zone. For example, Europe/Paris or America/Los_Angeles.

userSpecifiedPassword.description:
The password entered specifically by the end user.
This field should only be used when someone is creating their OWN user, never
when an administrator is creating a user for someone else.
This must never be a "default" or system-generated password.
Access to this field is limited to only the service accounts that require it.
All other consumers of CreateUser should instead initiate the Password Reset
process to allow the end-user themselves to set their own password.

meetingBookingUrl.title: Meeting booking url is where the user can provide a link for booking meetings

roleIds.description:
Users with ANY of the provided types will be returned
Empty list will return ALL users.

emailVerified.title: Search by email verified status, if requested

policiesBooleanOperator.title: Boolean operator supports the basic boolean expressions AND, OR, NOT

policiesForOperator.description:
- ANY: ANY struct inside of the list must match the PolicyNode to be true
 - ALL: ALL structs inside of the list must match the PolicyNode to be true
policiesForOperator.title: ForOperator defines how the SubjectResourceFor clauses will evaluate the list of StructAttributes

resourceAttributeName.title: Name of the resource's attribute to compare against

resourceAttributeValue.title: Value to compare against the resource's attribute

thenPolicy.title: If the check matches, "then_policy" will be evaluated

elsePolicy.title: If the check fails, "else_policy" will be evaluated

policiesIfClause.description:
IfClause will check whether the given attribute value intersects with the resource's attribute at the given name.
If the provided value is present on the resource, "then_policy" will be evaluated, otherwise "else_policy" will be evaluated.

policiesOperator.description:
Operator consists of a boolean conjunction and one to two children nodes.
NOT is the only conjunction that supports a single child node, whereas AND and OR both require exactly two child nodes.

subjectResourceIntersection.description: Validates that the intersection between subjects and resources is not an empty set.

operator.title: Allows conjuctions between many policy nodes (AND, OR, and NOT)

subjectValueIntersection.title: Validates that the subject has a specific value

subjectMissingValue.description: Validates that the subject has a specific missing value.

subjectResourceSubset.description: Validates that the resources attributes is a subset of the subjects attributes.

subjectResourceFor.description: Iterates over a list of StructAttributes and validates the entries match the policy described.

ifClause.title: Checks conditional, branches into different paths depending on the result

policiesPolicyNode.description:
A PolicyNode can either be a Boolean operator over one or more child PolicyNodes, or it can be an SubjectResourceIntersectionClause.
A policy tree might look like this where C1, C2, C3 are SubjectResourceIntersectionClauses:
         AND
        /   \
       C1   OR
           /  \
          C2  C3
This means that the expression would be evaluated as C1 && (C2 || C3)
Arbitrary nesting is valid.

policiesSubjectMissingValueClause.title:
SubjectMissingValueClause is true if the subject attribute keyed by attribute_name is either missing or has no values.
eg: with attribute_name = "market_id", then a subject with "market_id" = [] is TRUE, a subject with "market_id" = ["something"] is FALSE,
and if the subject simply doesn't have an attribute called "market_id" then this clause is TRUE

policiesSubjectResourceForClause.description:
SubjectResourceForClause will loop through a list of StructAttributes and return true if any or all match the PolicyNode defined.
The Subject MUST have a ListAttribute that contains StructAttributes at the attribute_name key for this to be evaluated.

policiesSubjectResourceIntersectionClaus.description:
SubjectResourceIntersectionClause is true if the set of values keyed by attribute_name on the resource has a non-empty
intersection with the set of values keyed by resource_attribute_name (or optionally attribute_name if
resource_attribute_name is not provided) on the subject. eg: with attribute_name = "account_group_id" then the subject
MUST have an attribute named "account_group_id" that contains any individual value of the resource's
"account_group_id" attribute for this clause to be considered TRUE.

policiesSubjectResourceSubsetClause.description: SubjectResourceSubsetClause is true if the set of values keyed by attribute_name on the resource is a subset of the set of values keyed by attribute_name on the subject.

attributeName.title: Name of the attribute to compare against, use periods to denote inner struct attribute names

structuredAttributeValue.title: Attribute value to compare against, must be a non struct attribute

policiesSubjectValueIntersectionClause.description:
SubjectValueIntersectionClause describes how an attribute's value on the subject must contain the arbitrary value specified by attribute_value.
eg: with attribute_name = "subject_type" and attribute_value = "partner", then the subject MUST have an attribute named
"subject_type" that contains the value "partner". Note that this is different from SubjectResourceIntersectionClause because we don't
care about this attributes presence on the resource or its value, it is purely for enforcing constraints on the subject itself.

protobufNullValue.description:
`NullValue` is a singleton enumeration to represent the null value for the
`Value` type union.

The JSON representation for `NullValue` is JSON `null`.

 - NULL_VALUE: Null value.

v1AccessScope.description:
AccessScope represents the spectrum of intents that a resource may be accessed with. Different intents may entail the evaluation
of different policies, as policies are associated not only to resources, but to specific AccessScope within the scope of that resource.

DEPRECATED: use "actions" instead of "operations"

email.description:
Deprecated: use user_identifier instead
The email of the subject to add a key for.

algorithmType.title: The algorithm to use to generate the key

userIdentifier.description: The identifier for the user to create a key for.

privateKey.description: The matching private key for the public key generated by IAM. This key is not stored by IAM and can not be retrieved again.

keyId.description: The identifier of the matching public key.

currencyCode.title: currency code according to ISO-4217, e.g. 'USD', 'CAD', 'BRL', etc

v1Context.description:
Context scopes a request to a specific persona.  A persona can either be a typed or a typed/namespace unique pair.
A typed context scopes a persona to a specific type, such as a partner user.
A namespaced context scopes a persona to a specific type and a given namespace, such as an SMB that belongs to a
specific partner.

context.description: The namespace and type of the session that is being created.

subject.description: The session subject, this should be some identifier of the subject, for example an Account Group ID.

attributes.title: These attributes will be added to the session and will be used during policy evaluation

session.title: A session token (aka an IAM identity token) which contains a subject's attributes instead of referring to a user for them

context.description: Context is required which indicates the specific persona of a given subject.

subjectId.description: The subject id that will be deleted.

deleteValue.title: deletes the field's current value from the object

impersonatee.title: user identifier of impersonatee (the user being impersonated)

token.title: A token with the impersonated user field set

session.title: A session token (aka an IAM identity token)

v1GetSubjectsResponse.title: Response message for IAM.GetSubjects and IAM.GetSubjectsByEmail

token.description: token is a session token that has been signed by IAM. It can be used as a bearer token on subsequent calls to IAM.

cursor.description: Cursor allows paging of results, the next_cursor returned by the last response is expected.

pageSize.description: The number of results to return.

type.description:
Type allows filtering the Personas to a specific Subject type. This is an optional field, leaving it blank will
allow retrieving Personas across all types.

namespace.description:
namespace allows filtering the Personas to a specific Subject namespace. This is an optional field, leaving it blank will
allow retrieving Personas across all namespaces. Typed Personas will always be included in list.

alwaysIncludeSuperadmin.title:
If always_include_superadmin is true, then always return the partner persona associated to the the specified
user_identifier if that user is a superadmin.
This allows the inclusion of a superadmin partner persona on the list results even if the namespace doesn't match

subjectId.title: A subject id for a user's persona

v1Identifier.title: Identifier is a way to identify a user

cursor.description: Cursor allows paging of results, the next_cursor returned by the last response is expected.

pageSize.description: The number of results to return.

type.description:
Type allows filtering the Personas to a specific Subject type. This is an optional field, leaving it blank will
allow retrieving Personas across all types.

namespace.description:
namespace allows filtering the Personas to a specific Subject namespace. This is an optional field, leaving it blank will
allow retrieving Personas across all namespaces. Typed Personas will always be included in list.

session.description: A session token (aka an IAM identity token). Required.

cursor.description: Cursor allows paging of results, the next_cursor returned by the last response is expected.

pageSize.description: The number of results to return.

type.description:
Type allows filtering the Personas to a specific Subject type. This is an optional field, leaving it blank will
allow retrieving Personas across all types.

namespace.description:
namespace allows filtering the Personas to a specific Subject namespace. This is an optional field, leaving it blank will
allow retrieving Personas across all namespaces. Typed Personas will always be included in list.

nextCursor.description:
A string indicating the starting position of the next set of results. The client should pass this in the
the next request.

hasMore.description: A bool indicating if there are more results to be paged through.

v1MultiValueAttribute.description:
Represents a key-[]value pair used for representing the known attributes on a subject, as well as replace
in IAM.MutateSubject.

context.description: Context is required which indicates the specific persona of a given subject.

mutations.description: A list of mutations that will be applied atomically.

add.description:
Deprecated: use add_attributes instead
Will add the value to the list of values at that key or if it doesnt exist will set the attribute
to the given value.

replace.description:
Deprecated: use replace_attributes instead
Replace will delete the values at the given key and use the given list of values in its place.

remove.title:
Deprecated: use remove_attributes instead
Remove will delete the values at the given key

dropKey.title: Will drop the key specified. Use periods to drop inner keys (name.inner_name)

replaceAttributes.title: Will set and replace the keys in the struct to the corresponding attributes

addAttributes.title: Will add values to the corresponding attributes

removeAttributes.title: Will remove values from the corresponding attributes

v1Mutation.description: Mutation mutates a subject in a MutateSubject request.

v1NamespacedContext.description: Indicates a context that is scoped to a type/namespace pair.

namespace.title: Deprecated: Ignored because a token already uniquely identifies a user

session.title: A session token (aka an IAM identity token)

v1OrderByDirection.title: Indicates the sort order for IAM.SearchSubject

v1Persona.description: A Persona is a Subject and Context combination that provides the ability for cross context usage for a single subject.

v1Query.description:
Query allows callers of IAM.SearchSubject to do full text search against the attributes of a scoped set of subjects.
search_term will be queried against the supplied set of attribute keys.

password.title: The plain text password to set for the persona

attributes.description:
Deprecated: use struct_attributes instead
The set of attributes that belong to the subject persona.

structAttributes.description: The set of struct attributes that belong to the subject persona.

subjectId.description: The newly generated subject persona ID.

email.description:
Deprecated: use user_identifier instead
The email of the subject to remove a key from.

keyId.description: The id of the public key to delete. Tokens signed by the corresponding private key will no longer be considered valid by IAM.

userIdentifier.description: The identifier for the user to remove a key from.

token.title:
A one-time-use, time-sensitive JWT that can only be used to reset the password.
The one-time-use condition will be enforced using the current password hash as part of the signing secret

identifiers.description: identifiers is a set of parameters that a resource owner needs to identify a resource.

v1ResourceIdentifier.description: ResourceIdentifier is a set of identifiers that a resource owner needs to identify a resource.

appId.title: app_id is a unique identifier for the registrant. It must be unique across all IAM resource owners. (eg "VBC")

appName.title: app_name is the human readable name of the application registering as a Resource Owner (eg "Vendasta Business Center")

v1ResourceOwner.description: ResourceOwner is an application that owns one or many distinct resources.

context.description: Context is required, which scopes the search to a specific set of personas.

query.description: Query will be used as a full text search query with partial matching.

filters.description: Filters will be applied as a boolean filter with no partial matching.

orderBy.description: Indicates the attribute to order by.

orderByDirection.description: Indicates to sort by ascending or descending.

cursor.description: Cursor allows paging of results, the next_cursor returned by the last response is expected.

pageSize.description: The number of results to return.

fieldMask.description: A field mask to apply to the results returned.

result.description: A list of results that matched the given search criteria.

nextCursor.description:
A string indicating the starting position of the next set of results. The client should pass this in the
the next request.

hasMore.description: A bool indicating if there are more results to be paged through.

totalResults.description: An int64 indicating the total number of results returned by the query.

v1SingleValueAttribute.description: Represents a key-value pair for adding/removing values in mutate, as well as filtering results in IAM.SearchSubject.

subjectId.description: A subject ID is a globally unique id across all personas and contexts.

userId.title: User ID that the subject belongs to

partnerId.description: The partner ID that the subject belongs to.

attributes.description:
Deprecated: use struct_attributes instead
The set of attributes that belongs to the subject persona.

created.title: The time when the subject persona was created

updated.description: The time when the subject peronsa was last updated.

lastLogin.title:
Deprecated: use last_login on the User message instead.
The time when the subject peronsa last authenticated with IAM.AuthenticateSubject

publicKeys.description: Public keys that are able to validate tokens issued by the subject.

structAttributes.description: The set of struct attributes that belong to the subject persona.

v1Subject.description: A subject represents a specific persona for a specified context.

v1SubjectResult.description: A SubjectResult wraps a subject since nil values are not allowed in a repeated set. Therefore subject can be nil.

v1TypedContext.description: Indicates a context that is scoped to a type.

fieldMask.description: Supported updates for name, and description only at this time.

v1ValueList.title: ValueList is a holder for multiple string values in order to be compatible with map declarations

userIdentifier.description: The user to add a new client key for.

algorithmType.title: The type of key to add

privateKey.description: The matching private key for the public key generated by IAM. This key is not stored by IAM and can not be retrieved again.

clientKeyId.description: The identifier of the matching public key.

roleId.description:
The type of role, e.g. "smb", "partner", etc.
Your service must own a given role in order to add it to a user.

attributes.title:
Attributes associated with the role.
These are used in conjunction with policies for Access Checks

country.title: Country code: ISO code 3166 format (CA, US)

state.title: State code: ISO code 3166-2 format (CA-SK, US-FL)

userIdentifier.title: The user to attempt to change their password for

currentPassword.title: The current password the user has

user.title:
User properties to include on the created user.
UserID should be left blank as it will be generated by the server
UserRoles should be left blank, add them with "AddUserRole"

typedExternalIdentifiers.description: Optionally used to store the ids of the user in the system that triggered the create user request.

resetPasswordToken.description: A one-time-use, time-sensitive token that can only be used to reset the password.

refreshToken.title: refresh token given by a previous call of get session

clientAssertion.title: Assertion signed by a private key provided by a client using 2-legged oauth flow

federatedIdentityProvider.title: The name of the Identity Provider used to federate identity, e.g. google

scopes.title: Scopes to be added to the access token

clientId.description:
The client id that the session is being created for.
If an client_id is not passed, the client_id will fall back to IAM as the client_id.
For OAuth2 a client_id should always be given, unless providing a client_assertion as your ID.

nonce.title:
When an ID token is generated, a nonce field is used for to associate the client to the given id token and
mitigate replay attacks.
https://openid.net/specs/openid-connect-core-1_0.html#IDToken

impersonateeUserId.title: The user ID of the user being impersonated (optional)

serviceProviderId.title: Service provider id that the tokens are to be made for and returned to

legacyUserId.description:
legacy_user_id is the subject ID that acted as the user ID in ssov3 marketplace integrations
Some vendors use this to maintain backwards compatibility with marketplace APIs.

consentingUserId.description:
The user ID of the person who provided consent for the scopes of a service account user.
This field is primarily used when tokens are issued to automations where we want
to track the user who activated the automation on behalf of the service account.

identityToken.description: An IAM identity token, which is different than oidc_identity_token.

refreshToken.title: A refresh token for the iam access token

publicProfileId.title: Public profile identifier used to build Linkedin public profile URL, e.g.: 'https://www.linkedin.com/in/${public_profile_id}'

cursor.description: Cursor allows paging of results, the next_cursor returned by the last response is expected.

pageSize.description: The number of results to return.

roleTypes.title: Filter to resources that support at least one of the specified role types

resourceIds.title: Filter to resources that contain at least one of the specified resource ids

resourceAttributes.title: Filter to resources that contain at least one of the specified resource attributes

subjectAttributes.title: Filter to resources that contain at least one of the specified subject attributes on its policies

actions.title: Filter to resources that contain at least one of the specified actions on its policies

appIds.title: Filter to resources that contain at least one of the specified app ids

cursor.title: Cursor to begin the list from

v2OneTimePasswordCredentials.title: A user and a one time password

phoneNumber.title: The phone number stored in the tel RFC3966 format https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3966

userRoleMetadata.title: A description of the role being registered

userIdentifier.title: The user to remove the key from

clientKeyId.title: The identifier for the key to remove

roleId.description:
The type of role, e.g. "smb", "partner", etc.
Your service must own a given role in order to remove it from a user.

ownerId.description:
Which service owns this resource
Should be "lower-kebab-case".

resourceKind.title:
An identifier for the resource; previously "resource_id".
Should be "lower-kebab-case"

resourceDescription.description: A human-readable description of when this resource is used for access checks.

policies.title: map of action to policy for this resource

version.description:
DEPRECATED: Semantic version (vX.X.X) used to track updates to a resource
If the specified version is the same as the current resource version updates will not be applied
Decreasing the version will update the resource but will not rollback to a previous state.

callbackResourceData.description: Contains data required for registering callback resources.

email.title: The email user tries to sign in with

resetPasswordToken.title: The password reset token which was sent in a password reset email

newPassword.title: The new password to set on the user

invalidateActiveSessions.title: Invalidates user's active sessions if reset was successful

resourceAttributes.title: The inferred set of resource attributes

actions.title: Inferred list of actions across all policies on the resource

version.title: DEPRECATED: Semantic version (vX.X.X) used to track updates to a resource

cursor.description: Cursor allows paging of results, the next_cursor returned by the last response is expected.

pageSize.description: The number of results to return.

userId.title: User ID to send the email to

templateId.title: the template id to use for the email

parameters.title:
Substitution parameters
Supports dot pathing in the template content; for example, given `productName['.Workflow.Step1.ProductId']` will go Workflow > Step1 > ProductId into
parameters and get the associated value

nextUrl.title: Provide a url for the user to navigate to after exchanging the OTP for a session

nextUrlButtonText.title: Provide the text for the button the user will click to navigate to the provided next_url

roleId.description:
The type of role, e.g. "smb", "partner", etc.
Your service must own a given role in order to add it to a user.

userIdentifier.description: The identifier for the user to update/insert an external id for.

typedExternalIdentifier.description: The type and value of external ID to insert/update.

limitsId.title: ID that maps to the limits of the Partner

includeRoles.title:
Whether to include the user roles in the response
Deprecated, roles are always included

roleId.description: The type of role, e.g. "smb", "partner", etc.

attributes.title:
Additional attributes associated with the role.
These are used in conjunction with policies for Access Checks

created.title: When this role was first created on this user

updated.title: When this role was last updated on this user

v2UserRole.description:
A user has many roles
Roles contain attributes which are used in access checks.

roleId.title: The role's identifier, e.g. digital_agent, smb, partner

ownerUserId.description:
The user who owns this role (typically a service account)
Only the owner of a role are allowed to edit or view that role's attributes for a user.

name.title:
Human readable name for the role
E.g. "Digital Agent"

description.title: What is this role used for?

paths.description: The set of field mask paths.

vendastatypesFieldMask.title: `FieldMask` represents a set of symbolic field paths, for example:

cursor.title: cursor can be passed to retrieve the next page of results keyed by the cursor

pageSize.title: page_size specifies the number of items to return in the next page

nextCursor.title: A cursor that can be provided to retrieve the next page of results

hasMore.title: Whether or not more results exist

totalResults.title: The total number of results. This is not supported on all paged apis and will be 0 if it is not supported
